Architectural Intertia

The real reason for legacy code!

Posted by Srinivasan on June 25, 2019 · 120 1 min read

When Sir Isaac Newton coined the term inertia in Principia Mathematicia, he applied it only to physical objects that he observed in the universe. As per Newton’s First law Inertia is defined as follows

Isaac Newton’s first law of motion states that—unless the body is acted upon by some force—a body in motion tends to remain in motion and a body at rest tends to remain at rest.

This law is extremely popular and so profound that it is applied in a variety of scenarios in physics to understand the motion of different objects. What if we can apply the concept of intertia to software development? Does it make sense?

The answer is an overwhelming Yes.
